White (2002âpresent)[http://www.tomwelling.org/tom/biography/ Tomwelling.Org - Tom Welling Fansource - About Tom - Biography] | website= }} '''Thomas John Patrick''' "'''Tom'''" '''Welling''' (born April 26, 1977) is an American actor, [[television director|director]], [[television producer|producer]], and former [[model (person)|model]], best known for his portrayal of [[Clark Kent (Smallville)|Clark Kent]] in the [[The WB Television Network|WB]]/[[The CW Television Network|CW]] series ''[[Smallville]]''. A high school athlete, Welling initially worked in construction and in 1998 he successfully modeled men's clothing for several popular brands. In 2000, he made a successful transition to television. He has been nominated and received several awards for his portrayal of Clark Kent. He also had a recurring role in ''[[Judging Amy]]''. He has also been involved behind the camera as an [[executive producer]] and a [[Television director|director]]. His films include ''[[Cheaper by the Dozen (2003 film)|Cheaper by the Dozen]]'', [[Cheaper by the Dozen 2|its sequel]], and the [[The Fog (2005 film)|2005 remake]] of ''[[The Fog]]''. ==Early life== Welling was born in upstate New York on April 26, 1977.{{cite web|url=http://www.teenmag.com/celeb-stuff/getting-to-know/tom-welling |title=Interview with Smallville's Tom Welling |publisher=Teen Magazine |date=1977-04-26 |accessdate=2010-03-04}} His family moved frequently, making stops in [[Wisconsin]], [[Delaware]], and [[Michigan]]. Welling attended [[Okemos High School]] in [[Okemos, Michigan]], where he started acting in plays, but then switched into sports. Welling played baseball and soccer, but his favorite sport is basketball. Welling is one of four children.{{cite web|url=http://www.filmmonthly.com/Profiles/Articles/TWelling/TWellingCheaper.html |title=Paul Fischer Interviews Tom Welling |publisher=Filmmonthly.com |accessdate=2010-03-04}} His brother, Mark Welling, is also an actor. ==Career== Originally a construction worker, Welling was discovered in 1998 at a party in [[Nantucket]] by a catalog camera scout who suggested he try modeling. Welling modeled for Louisa Modeling Agency until 2000, when he relocated to Los Angeles. There he modeled for [[Tommy Hilfiger]], [[Abercrombie & Fitch]], and [[Calvin Klein]] while pursuing an acting career. Welling has stated that he did not like modeling and that he was not good at it because it was all on the outside or from an external point of view. He pursued acting because he wanted to express a range of emotions. In his first major acting role, Welling portrayed karate teacher Rob Meltzer, ''a.k.a'' "Karate Rob", a younger love interest of [[Amy Brenneman]]'s character on the [[CBS]] series ''[[Judging Amy]]'', which aired in 2001. Welling was originally signed for three episodes; after receiving enthusiastic fan reviews, the producers kept him for three more. Welling also had a small role in [[UPN]]'s ''[[Special Unit 2]]'', and he appeared in the debut episode of the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]] sitcom ''[[Undeclared (TV show)|Undeclared]]''. ===''Smallville''=== [[Image:TomWellingAsSuperman.jpg|right|thumb|Tom Welling as Superman/Clark Kent.]] Welling was cast in the television series ''[[Smallville]]'' after a nationwide search for an actor to play [[Clark Kent]]. In an interview with a teen magazine, Welling spoke about the day he auditioned for the role: "I was on my way back from the [[Warner Bros.]] studio, and I stopped in a gas station to call my manager and tell him how it went. I called and got him on the phone and he said, 'Can you hold on a second?' Next thing I know, there are literally seven people on the other line and almost in unison they say, 'Tom, you got it!'" The [[Pilot (Smallville)|pilot]] aired in October 2001, and became the highest-rated debut for [[the WB Television Network|The WB]], with 8.4 million viewers.{{cite web|url=http://tv.zap2it.com/tveditorial/tve_main/1,1002,271|title=The WB Orders More 'Smallville'|date=2001-10-24| publisher=tv.zap2it.com|accessdate=2006-10-19|unused_data=71462|1|,00.html}} Welling told ''[[TV Guide]]'' that he turned down the lead role twice, but after reading the script, decided to take the job. Like [[Christopher Reeve]], he was not a ''[[Superman]]'' fan prior to being cast as Clark Kent. In fact, he said, he continues to not read ''Superman'' comics: "I made a conscious decision to stay away from that material. We're doing something different at a time before all that, I don't want that to affect what I'm doing, even subconsciously."{{cite web|url=http://movies.about.com/cs/cheaperbythedozen/a/cbtdtw121003_2.htm |title=Tom Welling Interview â Cheaper by the Dozen Movie and Smallville |publisher=Movies.about.com |date=2009-10-30 |accessdate=2010-03-04}} He did get the chance to meet two previous ''Superman''s: [[Christopher Reeve]], when the actor was invited on ''Smallville'' in the Season 2 episode "[[Smallville (season 2)#Rosetta|Rosetta]]", and [[Dean Cain]] in the Season 7 episode Cure.{{cite web|url=http://www.kryptonsite.com/twyearbook1.htm |title=Tom Welling Interview from SV Yearbook |publisher=KryptonSite |accessdate=2010-03-04}} Welling was named one of ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' magazineâs "Breakthrough Stars of 2001", and also won the [[Teen Choice Award]] as "Choice Breakout Star (Male)" in 2002 for his role as Clark Kent.{{cite web|title=Shows â Smallville â Cast â Tom Welling|url=http://cwtv.com/shows/smallville/cast/tom-welling|work=The CW|accessdate=2007-01-25}} Following the third season, Welling was interviewed by [[Smallville Magazine]] and stated that if he could play one character on the show that was not Clark Kent, it would be the character of [[Lex Luthor]]; "Lex Luthor! I wouldnât mind having my head shaved â as an actor, [it is the ultimate,] getting to play the complete opposite of your character."{{cite web|url=http://www.supermantv.net/smallville/Tom_Wellingmagazine.htm |title=Tom Welling Interview |publisher=Supermantv.net |accessdate=2010-04-16}} In 2004 Welling was approached about starring in the big screen adaptation of Superman when director [[Brett Ratner]] was attached to project. Comic book artist [[Alex Ross]] even did two sketches of Welling as the "[[Superman|Man of Steel]]" to see what the actor would look like in the famous costume.{{cite web|title=Alex Ross Draws Tom Welling as Superman!|url=http://www.superherohype.com/features/articles/85243-exclusive-alex-ross-draws-tom-welling-as-superman|publisher=Alex Ross Art|date=2004-04-16|accessdate=2010-05-10}} In August 2009, Welling won another [[Teen Choice Award]] as "Choice TV Actor (Action Adventure)" for ''Smallville''.{{cite news|url=http://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2009-08-10-teen-choice-winners_N.htm?csp=34 |title=Teen Choice Awards winners |publisher=USA Today |date=2009-08-10 |accessdate=2010-03-04}} ===Directing=== Welling made his directorial debut in 2006, with the season five episode of ''Smallville'', "[[Smallville (season 5)#Fragile|Fragile]]". He also directed the season six episode "[[Smallville (season 6)#Hydro|Hydro]]", the show's 150th episode "[[Smallville (season 7)#Apocalypse|Apocalypse]]", the season eight episode "[[Smallville (season 8)#Injustice|Injustice]]", and the second part of season nine's ''[[Absolute Justice]]'' movie, which was titled ''Legends''. Later, he directed two episodes of ''Smallville'''s last season: ''Patriot'' and ''Booster''. ''Booster'' was written by [[Geoff Johns]], who also wrote ''[[Absolute Justice]]''. ===Film and production=== In December 2003, Welling played Charlie Baker, the oldest son and second oldest in the Baker family which had 12 children in the film ''[[Cheaper by the Dozen (2003 film)|Cheaper by the Dozen]]'', which is a remake of the [[Cheaper by the Dozen (1950 film)|1950 movie]] starring [[Clifton Webb]] and [[Myrna Loy]], based on the 1948 [[Cheaper by the Dozen|book]] by [[Frank Bunker Gilbreth, Sr.|Frank]] and [[Lillian Moller Gilbreth|Lillian Gilbreth]]. Welling talked about why he was interested in the project in an interview with Paul Fischer: "The top three reasons I decided to do this film were, one, Steve Martin, two, Steve Martin and three, Steve Martin. That was the number one draw for me. Then, after reading the script, I really liked this character, Charlie. I liked what he went through, what he had to go through, and I felt I understood where he was coming from. And I just wanted to be a part of it." Welling had always been a fan of [[Steve Martin]]'s and stated that he "absolutely loved" working with him. In 2005, Welling appeared as Nick Castle in ''[[The Fog (2005 film)|The Fog]]'', a remake of [[John Carpenter|John Carpenter's]] [[The Fog|1980 film of the same name]] and he reprised his role as Charlie Baker in ''[[Cheaper by the Dozen 2]]''. For ''Smallville'''s ninth season, Welling served as a co-executive producer. He returned as Clark Kent for the show's tenth and final season in Fall 2010 and has become a full executive producer, as credited in a May 20, 2010 press release by the CW.{{cite web|url=http://blog.cwtv.com/2010/05/20/the-cw-announces-2010-2011-schedule/|title=The CW Announces 2010â2011 Schedule|publisher=CWtv.com|date=May 20, 2010|accessdate=June 6, 2010}} Welling still models occasionally and appeared in the May 2008 issue of ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'', the so-called ''Superhero Issue''.{{cite web|url=http://www.theinsider.com/news/848277_Tom_Welling_In_Vogue_Magazine_Photoshoot |title=Tom Welling In Vogue Magazine Photoshoot|publisher=The Insider |date= April 30, 2008 |accessdate=2010-03-04}}{{dead link|date=September 2011}} Welling executive produces ''[[Hellcats]]'', a new television series based on the book ''Cheer: Inside the Secret World of College Cheerleaders'' by journalist Kate Torgovnick.{{cite web|url = http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2010/02/02/pilot-intel-cw-tom-welling-hellcats/|title = Pilot intel: CW orders Tom Welling-produced drama|author = Michael Ausiello|date = February 2, 2010|work = Entertainment Weekly}}{{cite web|url = http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news.aspx?id=8512|publisher = The Futon Critic|title = Hellcats (a.a.a. Cheer) (The CW)|date = February 2, 2010}} The series first aired on [[The CW Television Network|The CW]] beginning in Fall 2010. Hellcats was canceled by the CW May 17, 2011. ==Personal life== Welling has been married to model Jamie White since 2002.{{cite web|url = http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/tom-welling/bio/177238|work = TV Guide|title = Tom Welling Biography |accessdate=2010-02-22}} They were married in [[Martha's Vineyard]] with Welling's friends and former ''Smallville'' co-stars [[Kristin Kreuk]] and [[Michael Rosenbaum]] in attendance.{{cite news|url = http://www.nytimes.com/2002/07/12/nyregion/boldface-names-960624.html?pagewanted=1 |title = Super Event for Superman |publisher=NYTimes.com |date=2002-07-12 |accessdate=2010-04-19 | first1=James | last1=Barron | first2=Jennifer | last2=Medina}} Welling and his wife reside in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Welling has stated in ''[[YM (magazine)|YM]]'' that he dislikes interviews. He said, "I don't want to be a celebrity for the sake of being a celebrity. I wanna work and then go home and live in private."{{cite web|url =http://news.google.co.uk/newspapers?id=_hknAAAAIBAJ&sjid=aNAEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4719,3662840&dq=tom-welling&hl=en |title = Young Superman hates interviews |publisher=Spartanburg Herald-Journal |date=2003-12-26 |accessdate=2010-04-22}} ==Filmography== ===Films=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
